attributes.action: Legally require that job applicant names are removed from applications form.
attributes.additional_details: Research by the UK government published in 2009 found that employers were much more likely to offer interviews to candidates with white-sounding names than those with non-white-sounding ones, even though their applications were identical. The name of a job applicant does not serve any purpose and does not hold relevance to the applicants suitability to be shortlisted for any job position.
attributes.background: We want ‘Name Blind’ recruitment to be a legal requirement for all private and public companies for all job roles. The aim is to reduce any  unconscious bias of applicants on the basis of ethnicity or gender at the initial stages of the recruitment and selection process.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/331511

We have also published several petitions about race and equality more widely, which you can view here: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions?state=open&topic=race-and-equality
